org.openstreetmap.gui.jmapviewer.interfaces

Interface TileSource

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Attributed
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TemplatedTileSource
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractOsmTileSource, AbstractTileSource, AbstractTMSTileSource, BingAerialTileSource, OsmTileSource.CycleMap, OsmTileSource.Mapnik, ScanexTileSource, TemplatedTMSTileSource, TMSTileSource

    public interface TileSource
extends Attributed

      • Methods inherited from interface org.openstreetmap.gui.jmapviewer.interfaces.Attributed

        getAttributionImage, getAttributionImageURL, getAttributionLinkURL, getAttributionText, getTermsOfUseText, getTermsOfUseURL, requiresAttribution

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxZoom

        int getMaxZoom()
        Specifies the maximum zoom value. The number of zoom levels is [0.. getMaxZoom()].
        Returns:
        maximum zoom value that has to be smaller or equal to JMapViewer.MAX_ZOOM

      • getMinZoom

        int getMinZoom()
        Specifies the minimum zoom value. This value is usually 0. Only for maps that cover a certain region up to a limited zoom level this method should return a value different than 0.
        Returns:
        minimum zoom value - usually 0

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        A tile layer name as displayed to the user.
        Returns:
        Name of the tile layer

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        A unique id for this tile source. Unlike the name it has to be unique and has to consist only of characters valid for filenames.
        Returns:
        the id

      • getTileUrl

        java.lang.String getTileUrl(int zoom,
                            int tilex,
                            int tiley)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs the tile url.
        Parameters:
        zoom - zoom level
        tilex - X coordinate
        tiley - Y coordinate
        Returns:
        fully qualified url for downloading the specified tile image
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any I/O error occurs

      • getTileId

        java.lang.String getTileId(int zoom,
                           int tilex,
                           int tiley)
        Creates tile identifier that is unique among all tile sources, but the same tile will always get the same identifier. Used for creation of cache key.
        Parameters:
        zoom - zoom level
        tilex - X coordinate
        tiley - Y coordinate
        Returns:
        tile identifier

      • getTileSize

        int getTileSize()
        Specifies how large each tile is.
        Returns:
        The size of a single tile in pixels. -1 if default size should be used

      • getDefaultTileSize

        int getDefaultTileSize()
        Returns:
        default tile size, for this tile source TODO: @since

      • getDistance

        double getDistance(double la1,
                   double lo1,
                   double la2,
                   double lo2)
        Gets the distance using Spherical law of cosines.
        Parameters:
        la1 - latitude of first point
        lo1 - longitude of first point
        la2 - latitude of second point
        lo2 - longitude of second point
        Returns:
        the distance betwen first and second point, in m.

      • latLonToXY

        java.awt.Point latLonToXY(double lat,
                          double lon,
                          int zoom)
        Parameters:
        lon - longitude
        lat - latitude
        zoom - zoom level
        Returns:
        transforms longitude and latitude to pixel space (as if all tiles at specified zoom level where joined)

      • latLonToXY

        java.awt.Point latLonToXY(ICoordinate point,
                          int zoom)
        Parameters:
        point - point
        zoom - zoom level
        Returns:
        transforms longitude and latitude to pixel space (as if all tiles at specified zoom level where joined)

      • xyToLatLon

        ICoordinate xyToLatLon(java.awt.Point point,
                       int zoom)
        Parameters:
        point - point
        zoom - zoom level
        Returns:
        WGS84 Coordinates of given point

                       int y,
                       int zoom)
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate
        y - Y coordinate
        zoom - zoom level
        Returns:
        WGS84 Coordinates of given point

        TileXY latLonToTileXY(double lat,
                      double lon,
                      int zoom)
        Parameters:

        lat - latitude
        zoom - zoom level
        Returns:

      • getTileXMax

        int getTileXMax(int zoom)
        Parameters:
        zoom - zoom level
        Returns:
        maximum X index of tile for specified zoom level

      • getTileXMin

        int getTileXMin(int zoom)
        Parameters:
        zoom - zoom level
        Returns:
        minimum X index of tile for specified zoom level

      • getTileYMax

        int getTileYMax(int zoom)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        maximum Y index of tile for specified zoom level

      • getTileYMin

        int getTileYMin(int zoom)
        Parameters:
        zoom - zoom level
        Returns:
        minimum Y index of tile for specified zoom level

      • isNoTileAtZoom

        boolean isNoTileAtZoom(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> headers,
                       int statusCode,
                       byte[] content)
        Determines, if the returned data from TileSource represent "no tile at this zoom level" situation. Detection algorithms differ per TileSource, so each TileSource should implement each own specific way.
        Parameters:
        headers - HTTP headers from response from TileSource server
        statusCode - HTTP status code
        content - byte array representing the data returned from the server
        Returns:
        true, if "no tile at this zoom level" situation detected

      • getMetadata

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getMetadata(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> headers)
        Extracts metadata about the tile based on HTTP headers
        Parameters:
        headers - HTTP headers from Tile Source server
        Returns:
        tile metadata
